James A, Fellows was elected to a three year term as Trustee-at-Large.
EDUCATIONAL RESEARCH AND COMMUNICATIONS CONVOCATION
The President announced that N.Y.S.E.R.T.A, would cooperate with the State
Education Department*s Educational Research and Communications Convocation
being held in Albany during the week of November 18-22. N.Y.S.E.R.T.A. will
participate in the program on Thursday, November 21. Details will be worked
out at a later date.
FALL MEETING
There was a great deal of discussion concerning the location of the Fall
meeting. Pinebrook Lodge was suggested as the site of the meeting, but
several members felt it was inconvenient and that some people might have
difficulty with transportation if the meeting were held there. It was
pointed out, however, that one of N.Y.S.E.R.T.A.*s most successful meetings
had been held at Pinebrook in September, 1961,
It was finally decided that the Fall meeting would be held at Pinebrook
Lodge, Upper Saranac Lake, on September 12, 13, and 14.
John Porter was appointed Program Chairman for the Fall meeting.
COMMITTEE CHAIRMEN
A1 Fredette was appointed Chairman of the RADIO STATION ACTIVATION Committee
to replace Jim Fellows who has moved out of the State.
The President asked the following Committee Chairmen to continue in their
present positions for another year:
DOSSIER COMMITTEE - Donald Schein, Chairman
TV STATION ACTIVATION COMMITTEE - John Porter, Chairman
MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE - Ruane Hill, Chairman
RESEARCH COMMITTEE - Loran Twyford, Chairman
ENGINEERING COMMITTEE - John Soergel, Chairman
CLOSED CIRCUIT TELEVISION COMMITTEE - William Millard, Chairman
LEGISLATIVE COMMITTEE - Les Martin, Jr., Chairman
LEGISLATIVE COMMITTEE
Dr. William Rock, Al Fredette, Donald Schein, and William Millard were
reappointed to membership on the Legislative Committee.
